title.narrative: International Campaign for Women's Right to Safe Abortion

description.narrative: The Campaign’s primary purpose is to promote universal access to safe, legal abortion as a women’s health and human rights issue, and to support women’s autonomy to make their own decisions whether and when to have children. The primary goals are to contribute towards a decrease in maternal mortality from unsafe abortion and an increase in women’s ability to decide whether and when to have children.

activity-date.narrative: All the actions were developed as planned,

The Campaign was conceived and formed in the context of wider, vibrant movements for public health and human rights, and a transformation of perspectives that give a ‘positive frame’ to abortion rights advocacy ‒ arising from scientific innovation, political and legal activism, and the importance of addressing social inclusion. The abortion rights movement internationally is growing, with new theories, new developments, new approaches, and new, often young, actors, and it is part of the Campaign's responsibility to reflect and magnify these.

recipient-country.narrative: The Centro de Promoción y Defensa de los Derechos Sexuales y Reproductivos (Promsex) in Lima, Peru, is the Campaign's institutional base and fiscal agent. The Campaign's work is managed by a full-time International Coordinator, working on a voluntary basis, and three part-time staff – the latter all young women based in London, UK.

sector.narrative: Increased attention to women’s right to safe abortion in key international, regional and national decision-making spaces.
